summary: Converts irregular data cubes into consistent datacubes.
description:
Convert irregular data cubes into consistent(in space and time) and complete data cubes, ensuring compatibility with machine learning and deep learning classification algorithms.

This process eliminates gaps and missing values, enabling the use of machine learning and deep learning algorithms for remote sensing data. A batch job result can be loaded by providing a reference to it.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The parameter allows you to specify the time interval between images in a data cube. The values for the period parameter follow the ISO8601 time period specification format. This format represents time intervals as P[n]Y[n]M[n]D, where Y represents years, M represents months, and D represents days. For example, if you set the period as P1M, it signifies a one-month interval, while P15D represents a fifteen-day interval.

parameters.name: extent
parameters.description: A bounding box, which may include a vertical axis (see `base` and `height`).

base.description: Base (optional, lower left corner, coordinate axis 3).

height.description: Height (optional, upper right corner, coordinate axis 3).

crs.description: Coordinate reference system of the extent, specified as as [EPSG code](http://www.epsg-registry.org/) or [WKT2 CRS string](http://docs.opengeospatial.org/is/18-010r7/18-010r7.html). Defaults to `4326` (EPSG code 4326) unless the client explicitly requests a different coordinate reference system.

returns.description: A regular data cube in space and time.
